text.div:
This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/us/fhir-medmorph/CodeSystem/us-ph-response-message-processing-status defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
RRVS1 Reportable data sent from clinical care to PHA.Reportable - the triggered condition was determined to be reportable for responsible jurisdiction on the basis of appropriate authoring jurisdiction rules.
RRVS2 Data sent from clinical care to PHA may be reportable.May be reportable - the triggered condition may be reportable, but a full disposition was not achieved
RRVS3 Data sent from clinical care to PHA is not reportable.Not reportable - all data needed for rule were available, but the condition was not determined to be reportable for the responsible jurisdiction on the basis of appropriate authoring jurisdiction rules.
RRVS4 No Reporting rule met for the data setn from clinical care to PHA.No reporting rule met – no reporting rule was completely met because needed data were not available or all needed data were available but did not meet reporting requirements.

name: USPublicHealthResponseMessageProcessingStatus
title: US Public Health CodeSystem for Response Message Processing Status Codes
publisher: HL7 International - Public Health Work Group
description: The US Public Health ValueSet UseContext CodeSystem is a 'starter set' of codes supported for identifying response message processing status codes.

concept.display: Reportable data sent from clinical care to PHA.
concept.definition: Reportable - the triggered condition was determined to be reportable for responsible jurisdiction on the basis of appropriate authoring jurisdiction rules.

concept.display: Data sent from clinical care to PHA may be reportable.
concept.definition: May be reportable - the triggered condition may be reportable, but a full disposition was not achieved

concept.display: Data sent from clinical care to PHA is not reportable.
concept.definition: Not reportable - all data needed for rule were available, but the condition was not determined to be reportable for the responsible jurisdiction on the basis of appropriate authoring jurisdiction rules.

concept.display: No Reporting rule met for the data setn from clinical care to PHA.
concept.definition: No reporting rule met – no reporting rule was completely met because needed data were not available or all needed data were available but did not meet reporting requirements.
